Justification: The Time Traveller introduces his theories with confidence; no change yet.
He witnesses the Eloi and Morlocks, realizing his assumptions were naive.
He begins to fear the Morlocks and understand the dystopian reality.
His relationship with Weena begins to emotionally affect his motives.
After Weena’s death and further violence, he becomes disillusioned.
He returns changed, uncertain, shaken—an evangelist for caution, not conquest.
